programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: Border Force America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A shipment of meth disguised as concrete is intercepted, and officers interview a Haitian immigrant who has crossed nine countries on foot to reach America.

programme.title: Border Force America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Millions of dollars' worth of marijuana is found hidden in a shipment of mattresses, and officers detain a mother and daughter who have been smoking meth.

programme.title: Railroad Australia
programme.desc: Documentary series. A joyride turns ugly as a magnificent steam train is vandalised, and there is more drama in the outback as a 2,000-tonne freight train is in danger.

programme.title: Railroad Australia
programme.desc: Documentary series. A traffic jam splits a town in half and causes trouble for veteran driver Bernie Baker, and trainee Allie Hume is working hard to pass her final drivers' exams.

programme.title: Celebrity Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Ropley: Joe Wilkinson, Ulrika Jonsson, Mark Watson and Jenny Eclair are amongst the A-list auction hunters that Sean Kelly has to rein in, as more celebs haggle for storage lots.

programme.title: Celebrity Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Lewes: A-list auction anarchy as Vic and Bob, Theo Paphitis, Janet Street Porter, Stephen K Amos and Phil Tufnell scrap for storage lots, turning any profit over to charity.

programme.title: Railroad Australia
programme.desc: Documentary series. Timetables are tight as a major rail line is closed for repairs, and train spotters hunt for a locomotive that has been dubbed the Great White Shark.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The ever-popular motoring magazine, jam-packed with four-wheeled features. Richard takes the Morgan GT 8 for a spin. Actor Christian Slater is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Clarkson tests out the Aston Martin DBS and the boys attempt to spruce up some cheap Porsches. The not-so-young ones are also joined by legendary singer Cliff Richard.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Fresh Food
programme.desc: Rick Stein explores people's passion for food - here he visits the people behind a Bristol initiative which helps low-income families cook healthy and affordable food.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Fresh Food
programme.desc: Rick Stein presents a series exploring people's passion for food. In this edition, he meets a former schoolteacher who lives and eats like a Victorian.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: After an injury to one of their members, the Young Guns face a tough decision on how to continue mining. Plus, the Cheals break through to a long-lost underground mine. S3, Ep17

programme.title: Deadliest Catch

programme.title: New: Tiny House, Big Living
programme.desc: Tiny Alaskan Yurt. An Alaskan couple battle a harsh winter trying to finish their tiny house. Their two-storey yurt includes an underground freezer and a half-moon deck. S5, Ep10

programme.desc: A Race of Superhumans and a Letter to Alf: Sheldon agrees to help Missy with her maths homework. Georgie joins a bible study group to get closer to Veronica.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Tummy Ache and a Whale of a Metaphor: Sheldon spends some days in hospital, but he's the world's worst patient and his behaviour takes a toll on everyone.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The More You Ignore Me: Claire and Phil have their hands full when Luke gets arrested for driving without a licence, and then they catch Alex sneaking out of a liquor store.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Valloweaster: The squad compete to determine who's the greatest human/genius.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sienna's getaway hits the brakes when her family step in. Meanwhile, Froggy wants to bring his family back together, and a pact is made when two secret relationships are discovered.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: The village hosts a flower competition, but beneath the petals and polish, dark secrets threaten to be uncovered... Meanwhile, a grieving mum stirs up trouble.

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube Shorts
programme.desc: A short, cheeky clip from Rude Tube's naughty little sister Rude(ish) Tube, featuring sheep.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Sabatiello's: Gordon Ramsay sets his sights on Sabatiello's, an Italian restaurant in Connecticut that's better known for its owner Sammy's tantrums than the food.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Payback: The squad decide that it's high time for Peralta to pay them back all the money they've lent him over the years. Santiago and Holt reopen an arson case.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Defense Rests: Sophia's job gets in the way of her relationship with Peralta. Deputy Chief Wuntch needs Captain Holt's help with a job recommendation.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bull-E: Bart is picked on at the school dance, so Marge convinces Springfield's authorities to pass anti-bullying legislation. But then Homer's arrested for victimising Ned.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mathlete's Feat: Groundskeeper Willie coaches Lisa and the school Mathlympics team for an important maths quiz.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Nuclear Reactor and a Boy Called Lovey: Sheldon attempts to build a nuclear reactor. Georgie is heartbroken when he learns that Veronica has a boyfriend.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: David, Goliath and a Yoo-Hoo from the Back: Sheldon uses his new friendship with the school bully to boss Georgie around. Missy steals Meemaw's make-up.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: New Kids on the Block: Haley is determined to follow the advice in her parenting books with the twins, but Phil and Claire think their old methods are better.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Snapped: Claire needs to clear the house before anyone makes her look bad in front of a reporter from an important women's business magazine. Jay invites Manny to a wine tasting.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Pants Alternative: Sheldon is awarded a prestigious prize but is scared of collecting the award at a ceremony because he knows he'll have to make a speech.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Wheaton Recurrence: Leonard tells Penny that he loves her. The gang go bowling and find that Sheldon's enemy, Wil Wheaton, is playing in the opposing team.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Spaghetti Catalyst: Sheldon hides his friendship with Penny from Leonard, but it isn't long before his double life is exposed. Can he remain friends with both of them?

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Plimpton Stimulation: When Sheldon meets a famous physicist online, he invites her over to the apartment, where she spends her time flirting with Leonard.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Johnny and Dora: Peralta and Santiago go undercover to catch Brooklyn's most notorious identity thief, but working together brings them closer than ever before.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: New Captain: After Holt is transferred to the NYPD Department of Public Relations, the arrival of a new captain causes chaos at the precinct.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: King Leer: Moe inherits a mattress business from his father, then lands in an all-out war with his siblings.

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Cohabitation Formulation: Howard is torn between taking things to the next level with Bernadette and pleasing his mother. Leonard rekindles his relationship with Priya.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Toast Derivation: Sheldon is surprised and disturbed to find out that it's really Leonard who is at the centre of their group of friends and not him.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Prestidigitation Approximation: Leonard must choose between his new girlfriend Priya and his friendship with Penny. Howard drives Sheldon crazy with a magic trick.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A Milhouse Divided: When Milhouse's parents split up, his mum gets together with an American Gladiator called Pyro, his dad self-produces an album and Milhouse goes a bit crazy.

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: News
programme.desc: The leading news stories of the moment.

programme.title: Uncharted
programme.desc: (2022) Going-for-gold action. Tom Holland and Mark Wahlberg compare abs as they scour the globe for an olde explorer's lost gold. The heat is on. The time is right. Only the best survive.

programme.title: Bad Times at the El Royale
programme.desc: (2018) Crime thriller with Jeff Bridges, Jon Hamm, Dakota Johnson and Chris Hemsworth. A group of shifty strangers collide in a deserted motel that has its own buried secrets.

programme.title: Sheroes
programme.desc: (2023) She-heroes: action-with-attitude. Three young women transform into a Generation Z version of Charlie's Angels to rescue their mate from a drug lord in Thailand. Cue guns and bikinis.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Muppets from Space
programme.desc: (1999) The Muppets are back in another feature-length adventure as Gonzo, convinced that he is of alien origin, struggles to communicate with his family in outer space.

programme.title: Patrick
programme.desc: (2018) Feel-good British family comedy. Sarah's (Beattie Edmondson) chaotic life gets even more complicated when she inherits a naughty pug from her nan.

programme.title: The Call of the Wild
programme.desc: (2020) Touching adventure with Harrison Ford, based on Jack London's classic novel. A big, friendly hound finds himself unwittingly travelling across late 19th-century North America.

programme.title: The Sheriff of Fractured Jaw
programme.desc: (1959) Comedy western with Kenneth More. An English gunsmith decides the Wild West is the best market for his wares, but little does he expect to end up sheriff of a lawless frontier town.

programme.title: The Electrical Life of Louis...
programme.desc: ...Wain Interview Special: Stars Benedict Cumberbatch and Claire Foy talk about making director Will Sharpe's eccentric biopic of artist and inventor Louis Wain.

programme.title: Charlie's Angels
programme.desc: (2019) Action comedy with Kristen Stewart, Naomi Scott and Ella Balinska. When an engineer blows the whistle on a deadly device, the Angels put their lives on the line to save the planet.

programme.title: The G
programme.desc: (2023) Gritty crime thriller with Dale Dickey. An elderly couple get fleeced for their house and savings, so granny - aka The G - goes on a vengeful rampage. Be careful who you mess with.

programme.title: The Drop
programme.desc: (2014) Tense thriller with Tom Hardy, James Gandolfini, Noomi Rapace and Matthias Schoenaerts. Two cousins get into trouble with the gangsters who use their bar to launder illicit cash.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune and Fantasy
programme.desc: (2021) Ryûsuke Hamaguchi's triptych of short dramas tells the stories of three different women caught up in very different romantic relationships. In Japanese/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Tora! Tora! Tora!
programme.desc: (1970) Oscar-winning drama portraying the bombing of Pearl Harbor, from both American and Japanese perspectives. With Joseph Cotten and So Yamamura.

programme.title: The Art of Racing in the Rain
programme.desc: (2019) Touching comedy-drama. An ageing golden retriever (voiced by Kevin Costner) tells the story of his life with his best pal, a budding Formula 1 driver.

programme.title: Time Bandits
programme.desc: (1981) Fantasy comedy. David Rappaport stars as the leader of rebel dwarves who kidnap a boy, Craig Warnock, and take him on adventures across time. With Sean Connery and John Cleese.

programme.title: First Knight
programme.desc: (1995) Romantic drama based on Arthurian legend, starring Richard Gere, Sean Connery and Julia Ormond. Can nomadic swordsman Lancelot contain his love for King Arthur's fiancée?

programme.title: Nope
programme.desc: (2022) Western-infused sci-fi chiller with Daniel Kaluuya and Keke Palmer as cash-strapped horse trainers who try to supplement their income by filming alien goings-on at their ranch.

programme.title: Summer of Soul
programme.desc: (2021) Joyous, Oscar-winning documentary about the Harlem Cultural Festival: six huge, free, star-studded neighbourhood festivals that encapsulated 1969's swelling Black cultural pride.

programme.title: River
programme.desc: (2023) Farcical time-loop comedy about the staff and guests at a remote mountain hotel condemned to repeat the same two minutes over, and over, and over, and over again. In Japanese/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Mysterious Island
programme.desc: (1961) Sci-fi adventure based on Jules Verne's novel. Two men fleeing the US Civil War find an island inhabited by monsters (animated by Ray Harryhausen) and the mysterious Captain Nemo.

programme.title: Starman
programme.desc: (1984) John Carpenter's sci-fi romance with Jeff Bridges and Karen Allen. An alien is stranded on Earth, where he assumes the form of a widow's dead husband - and finds the locals hostile.

programme.title: The Man from Laramie
programme.desc: (1955) Classic western. James Stewart plays a stranger who arrives in a remote New Mexico town secretly seeking his brother's killer. With Donald Crisp, Alex Nicol and Arthur Kennedy.

programme.title: It Should Happen to You
programme.desc: (1954) Judy Holliday stars in this comedy as a smalltown girl who comes to New York and rents a billboard to publicise her name - and soon she's a TV star. With Jack Lemmon.

programme.title: 13 Going on 30
programme.desc: (2004) Breezy body-swap romcom. Following a disastrous birthday party, teen Jenna wishes she was '30, flirty and thriving'. And boom, she's Jennifer Garner with a fancy flat and a cool job.

programme.title: Beast
programme.desc: (2022) Thrilling romp starring Idris Elba as an all-action doctor who must protect his family from a man-slaying lion in the wilds of South Africa, armed with a jeep and a keen right hook.

programme.title: Seriously Red
programme.desc: (2022) Krew Boylan's musical comedy romance about a lost-in-life young woman who finds her way by impersonating the mighty Dolly Parton. But how far should she tread that glittering path?

programme.title: Uncharted
programme.desc: (2022) Going-for-gold action. Tom Holland and Mark Wahlberg compare abs as they scour the globe for an olde explorer's lost gold. The heat is on. The time is right. Only the best survive.

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host as four new stars - reality TV star Ekin-Su Cülcüloglu, actor and comedian Hugh Dennis, author and interiors expert Kelly Hoppen, and former footballer Shaun Wright-Phillips - and their mentors, cook for their loved ones. programme.title: Jimmy's Taste of Florida
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty heads towards Florida's East Coast where he tests his surfing abilities in the Atlantic waves on New Smyrna Beach before meeting local chef David for a culinary lesson in classic Southern Grits. Jimmy then visits the Kennedy Space Centre where tour guide Richard takes him to see the iconic launchpads and he talks space food with former astronaut Winston Scott

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as contestants Nikki Fox, Robert Rinder and Georgia Taylor 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: This time, Reuben and Corinne, a couple from south-west Scotland, spontaneous Sophie and her niece Charlotte from Colchester, and Paulette and Gary, a married couple from Sandwell try to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. Presented by Adil Ray

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as AJ from Manchester, Scarlett from Newquay, Nigel from Stockton-on-Tees and Elaine from Wakefield pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of Heathrow's test and trace policy, following Joel, the manager of the airport's testing centre, as he leads the charge in trying to reduce passenger stress and makes sure that everyone gets the right test for the right country. Things are heating up in immigration, where Passenger Experience Manager Suki has an emergency on his hands, and Security Officer Estefania gets an unexpected makeover

programme.desc: The unfolding trial pushes Rebecca to the brink as she begins to question who she should defend, and Cam's allegiance to the justice system is tested as details from the night of the murder are finally revealed

programme.title: EFL Cup Live
programme.desc: Grimsby Town v Manchester United (Kick-off 8.00pm). All the action from the second-round match, which comes from Blundell Park. League Two Grimsby defeated Shrewsbury Town 3-1 in the previous round to reach this stage for the second successive season. Their reward is this plum tie against a team that has won this trophy on six occasions, with the most recent of those triumphs coming in the 2022/23 season

programme.desc: Nicki Shields presents action from the seventh meeting of the season, featuring the 19th, 20th and 21st races, which came from Knockhill. Tom Ingram currently led the way in the standings, followed closely by Ash Sutton after a victory in the third race last time out at Croft

programme.title: Tom Kerridge Cooks Spain
programme.desc: The chef's journey takes him to Catalonia in his bespoke vintage food truck, beginning on the Ebro Delta. Tom is set to work by Juan, a rice farmer who is also Spain's Strongest Man. He discovers the backbreaking work required to work in harmony with local birdlife. The host's journey then takes him to Lleida, the produce heartland of Catalonia, for what could be the first day of the donut peach season

programme.title: The Fortune Hotel
programme.desc: The four remaining pairs face a Hotel Game with a twist that sees them targeting one another with daggers, but only if they can answer revealing questions about their rivals. The Day Trip Challenge sees one player from each pair imprisoned in a historic fort. They rely on their partner's communication skills to escape by solving symbol-based clues and racing to unlock their chained-up briefcases. Stephen Mangan hosts

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Adil Ray, featuring mother and son Diane and Sam from Peterborough, sisters Selim and Sefiat from London, and singers Karen and Sarah, a couple from Elland in West Yorkshire. They use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leave with nothing

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Stu from Stockton-on-Tees, Jane from Manchester, Billy from Surrey and Lisa from West Yorkshire pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Moira confronts Dylan, while Robert and Ross argue and John is up to something

programme.title: Tom Kerridge Cooks Spain
programme.desc: The chef's journey takes him to Catalonia in his bespoke vintage food truck, beginning on the Ebro Delta. Tom is set to work by Juan, a rice farmer who is also Spain's Strongest Man. He discovers the backbreaking work required to work in harmony with local birdlife. The host's journey then takes him to Lleida, the produce heartland of Catalonia, for what could be the first day of the donut peach season

programme.title: The Fortune Hotel
programme.desc: The four remaining pairs face a Hotel Game with a twist that sees them targeting one another with daggers, but only if they can answer revealing questions about their rivals. The Day Trip Challenge sees one player from each pair imprisoned in a historic fort. They rely on their partner's communication skills to escape by solving symbol-based clues and racing to unlock their chained-up briefcases. Stephen Mangan hosts

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Dawn of the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Sci-fi adventure starring Gary Oldman, Jason Clarke and Andy Serkis. With most of the human population wiped out, the world is now ruled by super-intelligent apes. But their chimp leader Caesar finds his loyalties divided when a small band of human survivors strike back.

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host as four new stars - reality TV star Ekin-Su Cülcüloglu, actor and comedian Hugh Dennis, author and interiors expert Kelly Hoppen, and former footballer Shaun Wright-Phillips - and their mentors, cook for their loved ones. They'll have to produce delicious dishes with the added pressure of not only impressing the chefs, but their friends and family who will also be in the studio including Hugh's friend David Baddiel

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Jimmy's Taste of Florida
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty heads towards Florida's East Coast where he tests his surfing abilities in the Atlantic waves on New Smyrna Beach before meeting local chef David for a culinary lesson in classic Southern Grits. Jimmy then visits the Kennedy Space Centre where tour guide Richard takes him to see the iconic launchpads and he talks space food with former astronaut Winston Scott

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of Heathrow's test and trace policy, following Joel, the manager of the airport's testing centre, as he leads the charge in trying to reduce passenger stress and makes sure that everyone gets the right test for the right country. Things are heating up in immigration, where Passenger Experience Manager Suki has an emergency on his hands, and Security Officer Estefania gets an unexpected makeover

programme.desc: The unfolding trial pushes Rebecca to the brink as she begins to question who she should defend, and Cam's allegiance to the justice system is tested as details from the night of the murder are finally revealed

programme.title: EFL Cup Live
programme.desc: Grimsby Town v Manchester United (Kick-off 8.00pm). All the action from the second-round match, which comes from Blundell Park. Their reward is this plum tie against a team that has won this trophy on six occasions, with the most recent of those triumphs coming in the 2022/23 season

The host's journey then takes him to Lleida, the produce heartland of Catalonia, for what could be the first day of the donut peach season

programme.title: The Fortune Hotel
programme.desc: The four remaining pairs face a Hotel Game with a twist that sees them targeting one another with daggers, but only if they can answer revealing questions about their rivals. The Day Trip Challenge sees one player from each pair imprisoned in a historic fort. They rely on their partner's communication skills to escape by solving symbol-based clues and racing to unlock their chained-up briefcases. Stephen Mangan hosts
